newsitem.title: CHINA: China chemical industry seen up 8.0 pct in 1997.
newsitem.headline: China chemical industry seen up 8.0 pct in 1997.

text.p: The output of China's chemical industry is seen growing in value by 8.0 percent in 1997 to 270 billion yuan ($32.53 billion), the Xinhua news agency said on Wednesday.
The sector would reform ailing state firms and try to boost exports, Xinhua quoted Minister of Chemical Industry Gu Xiulian as saying.
The ministry had plans to develop new products for use in the automobile, electronics and textile industries and would focus on agricultural chemicals, Gu said.
Demand for chemical fertilisers was seen at 31.51 million tonnes this year, up from a record 25 million tonnes in 1996, Xinhua quoted other ministry officials as saying.
China's chemical production value reached 252 billion yuan in 1996, a rise of 9.7 percent from the year before, official figures show.
